Message
Highlights

2 mutual groups

You and Penny L. are both in systems thinking network and Regenerative Development Community

About

Currently living in Barichara, Colombia, and a native of Boulder, Colorado, I have a passion for serving life and our beautiful planet Earth. I moved to Colombia to live out my dream of helping to regenerate the earth alongside my life partner, Joe Brewer. Together, we are doing ecosystem restoration work and helping to create a local regenerative economy in our bioregion in and around Barichara. We also co-founded the Design School for Regenerating Earth where we are helping to activate bioregional organizing and facilitating learning journeys and learning exchanges between bioregions across the planet. 

I'm passionate about integrating and applying unified science, integral philosophy, regenerative practices, and biodynamic healing and trauma resolution to everything I do. These passions combined with my comprehensive background in operations, project management, accounting, and administration means that I bring a unique combination of heart and organizational expertise to the various initiatives and organizations in which I'm involved. 

Please visit this website to learn more about the Design School for Regenerating Earth:
https://design-school-for-regenerating-earth.mn.co/

Please visit this website for more information on my healing practice:
https://pennyheiple.com

5d • 

So many of us are now living into the Design Pathway for Regenerating Earth through the Design School -- including how they are organizing in a place-based manner across our planetary network of bioregions.

Design School for Regenerating Earth

3,969 followers

5d • 

It has been so inspiring to watch as the place-based hubs continue organizing themselves in different parts of the world. Design School members are learning how to regenerate the Earth in their own local landscapes and bioregions.

Many of these place-based hubs are free to join and open to the public. The registry of the network is held within the Design School and is fully accessible to our members.

Join the Design School and find people who are organizing near you!

Penny L. Heiple 
 • 1st

Co-Founder Design School for Regenerating Earth

2d • 

A bioregional learning center born in the Rivers of the North Sea… 👏🙌🏼

Design School for Regenerating Earth

3,969 followers

2w • Edited • 

It is so inspiring to see bioregional organizing as it emerges -- like what is happening in the Rivers of the North Sea through the leadership of Design School members Annelieke Verkerk, Sandra Barth-Oosting, and Mark Marijnissen.

Last year, we hosted a learning journey about how to birth a bioregional learning center. This year we continued with a new one on how to organize your bioregion. These thematic areas are about practicing. Immersing ourselves in the process. Learning by doing. 

And this is exactly what the people living in the Rivers of the North Sea have been doing in earnest. Weaving with others who have similar aspirations -- like all of the different local teams who organize in collaboration with the Bioregional Weaving Labs Collective, Bioregioning South East Ireland, Korowód Bioregional Center, Bioregional Thames, théra, and more.

Many parallel efforts to do their local part that helps regenerate the Earth. This is really happening.

Onward, fellow humans.

Penny L. Heiple 
 • 1st

Co-Founder Design School for Regenerating Earth

5d • 

The energy that's fueled ecological and cultural overshoot has come from pulling ancient carbon out of the Earth exponentially faster than it was sequestered over millions of years by the daily flows of the sun, soil, and plants.

Carbon energy has also fueled the accumulation and power of fungible currency. Current financial capital is untethered from the biophysical constraints of Earth's capacity.

Says regenerative economist John Fullerton, "I know that the current economy is driven by finance and if the economic premise of our entire global economy is in conflict with the laws of physics, we have a serious problem."

It’s time for the Great (Re)Turning.
… more

Brian Puppa • 1st

Executive Director – Legacy Project

6d • 

So much is happening now that it can be very disorienting. People are trying to find their bearings, trying to find a story that makes some sense and can orient them. 
 
The co-stewards of Bioregional Earth – myself and Legacy Project Founder Susan Bosak, along with Joe Brewer and Penny L. Heiple of the Design School for Regenerating Earth – have been thinking a lot about this, and have written an article together.

We won't find what we need in the noise. 
 
There are so many "theories of change" and "transformational ideas" out there. Somehow we've come to believe that new is better, and abstraction is a higher form of thinking. But then we can't seem to figure out how to implement all the ideas people are generating. It's because we're starting in the wrong place.
 
We actually need to start with what's old, and has stood the test of time. And we need to start with what's real, on the ground, right under our feet.
 
That's why "bioregional" and "regenerative" work can't just be the trend of the moment, but has to be understood as living into the story of Bioregional Earth in the context of The Great (Re)Turning.
 
We draw on many voices in our latest collaborative article. To quote just one, John Fullerton, this is an "unfolding, filled with mystery and even magic. It cannot be achieved, only facilitated and participated in."
 
Check out the whole article about The Great (Re)Turning:
https://lnkd.in/g4puCp-E

Dr. Pete Jeffs 🐴 
 • 1st

Cultural Ecology / Regeneration & Land healing / Western European Atlantic Coastal BioRegion / Healing Circles & Wildings with Horses / BioRegional educator / StoryMoss

1w • Edited • 

A really beautiful article about the #BirdNations, and particularly about three – the amazing journeys of Pterodroma deserta, the #DesertasPetrel; Luscinia megarhynchos, the #Nightingale, and Cygnus columbianus bewickii, #BewicksSwan. This article recounts their extraordinary journeys. It is a delight. 

Next Thursday, 23rd October, 4pm GMT, in the Design School for Regenerating Earth, Elyes Mkacher and myself with the Western European Atlantic Coastal BioRegion will be holding a 1-hour celebration of the #BirdNations as BioRegional Ambassadors.

The #BirdNations connect our #BioRegions, and whilst we can often spend time "defining" those regions, it is important to remember that a BioRegion is never isolated – there may be a watershed or a specific ecozone, but, for example, the Western European Atlantic Coastal BioRegion is deeply connected to the region of the #GulfOfMexico, the warm saline waters that will then speed across the Atlantic and warm our region... Many of our #BirdNations – as this article beautifully illustrates – migrate from one BioRegion to another, as they overwinter in one region, and oversummer elsewhere. Watching animations of bird migrations enables us to visualise the to-and-fro movements that contribute to our planetary home. 

Please join us in the Design School for Regenerating Earth next Thursday, for this Inter-BioRegional Event. If you would like to join us please use this link. Membership of the school is $5 a month – a truly great $5 for all the amazingness that the School brings together. Your subscription also helps to fund regenerative projects in the School. 

Design School for Regenerating Earth: https://lnkd.in/eWjtzB84

Guardian article: https://lnkd.in/dwJB2wZC

Frances Pimentel Nevares 
 • 2nd

Regenerative Practitioner CoEvolving @Mother 🌎/ Founder, Weaver, Regenerative Real Estate & Sustainability Strategist @CoreHavens Network / Global Investments Advisor @ONECRE / International Correspondent @TheECOChannel

3w • Edited • 

Querida comunidad regenerativa,

Les invitamos con mucha alegría a nuestra próxima llamada del Grupo de Hispanohablantes de la Escuela de Diseño para Regenerar la Tierra (Design School for Regenerating Earth), que se realizará mañana, jueves 9 de octubre.

Esta serie de llamadas, que realizamos cada tres semanas, ha venido creciendo como un espacio de encuentro, inspiración y coaprendizaje para hispanohablantes de distintas regiones del mundo que están comprometidos con la regeneración de sus territorios.💫 

En estas sesiones compartimos experiencias, aprendizajes y procesos de regeneración territorial desde nuestras distintas biorregiones, mientras fortalecemos vínculos y colaboraciones que tejen la red viva de la Escuela, una red global de comunidades que se organizan como un micelio planetario — conectando corazones, saberes y acciones que restauran los sistemas de vida en la Tierra. 🌏 

La Escuela de Diseño para Regenerar la Tierra es una plataforma educativa y colaborativa creada por Joe Brewer y Penny L. Heiple, que busca activar una red planetaria de nodos biorregionales en proceso de regeneración ecológica, económica y cultural. A través de cursos, llamadas y espacios abiertos, personas de todo el mundo aprenden juntas a diseñar y co-crear desde los patrones vivos de la Tierra, generando impacto real en sus comunidades. 🌱

Novedad importante✨ 
La Escuela acaba de implementar cambios estructurales que permiten abrir este espacio al público en general, de manera gratuita, fomentando que más personas puedan participar, aprender y comenzar a organizarse localmente. En esta llamada hablaremos sobre estos cambios y cómo apoyan la creación de más nodos biorregionales en los países de habla hispana y más allá. 

Horario:
10:30 a.m. (EST) / 9:30 a.m. (CST) / 2:30 p.m. (UTC)

💻 Enlace para unirse a la llamada: https://lnkd.in/gpJ8pEbx

🌐 Para unirte a la Escuela y acceder a sus demás clases, recursos y comunidad global: https://lnkd.in/gddmBvJJ

Este es un espacio inclusivo, transparente y colaborativo, donde cada voz cuenta.💚 

Agradecemos profundamente a Joe y Penny por su labor y esfuerzo, a Elyes Mkacher por su apoyo como community tender, y a todos los líderes biorregionales que comparten abiertamente sus procesos, catalizando la regeneración planetaria desde lo local.

¡Te esperamos para seguir aprendiendo, compartiendo y tejiendo juntos este micelio regenerativo de esperanza y acción viva!

📷 Pexels & Akil Mazumder

Penny L. Heiple reposted this

StoryMoss Magazine

73 followers

3w • 

StoryMoss was honoured to speak recently with Dr. Pete Jeffs 🐴 for our In Conversation Series! A multi-talented cultural ecologist, designer and artist living on a houseboat in Devizes, UK, Pete hosts the Western European Atlantic Coastal BioRegion in the Design School for Regenerating Earth, and brings his vast depth of cultural and ecological knowledge to the healing and regenerative work of his new initiative, #RootToReef.

Pete's work is imbued with the values of Earthcare and respect for people, animals, ecosystems and the planet. His approach is rooted in ecological restoration and human connection.

In our wide-ranging conversation, Pete shared a taste of his storytelling artistry. As bioregional efforts are often focused on rivers and watersheds, Pete saw the need to complement this with a stronger awareness of coastal perspectives. His bi-weekly seminars in the Design School weave fascinating, thoughtful and deeply researched perspectives on the lifeways and social ecological dynamics of sea grasses, wild horses, oysters, saltmarshes, coastal ancestors, ancient folklore and more. 

StoryMoss loved collaborating with Pete in our recent coverage of the r3.0 conference, where he wrote thoughtful and thought-provoking reflections on the Seeqanamâhsak game of the herring, or "Spring Fish": https://lnkd.in/dgaDe3nW

And on Dr. Lyla June Johnston's keynote presentation on Indigenous, Regenerative BioRegional Design: https://lnkd.in/dQk_rWBu

Pete even designed our StoryMoss logo!!

Dr. Pete Jeffs 🐴 also recently authored the beautiful, soulful and inspiring #BirdsOfSpirit e-book, a celebration of the Bird Nations with original drawings and indigenous lore, inspired by the wisdom of each species: https://lnkd.in/dGXsERRY

In a few days, we're excited to share Pete's latest writing reflecting on "A Murder of Crows" - birds and language!

Vanessa Farr Emmanuelle Chiche Manda Scott Joe Brewer Penny L. Heiple Salvador Perez Marie-Angel Chevrier de Rien Bill Baue Ralph Thurm Dr Karen Lemke, PDC Elyes MkacherIna Päßler-Setzepfandt Maria-Elena Daynes
https://lnkd.in/dBVm6CcJ

Penny L. Heiple reposted this

StoryMoss Magazine

73 followers

1mo • Edited • 

For our In Conversation series, StoryMoss explores European indigeneity and the French cultural roots of bioregioning, speaking with Maria-Elena Daynes and Marie-Angel Chevrier de Rien, from the Bioregional Learning Centre of Théra, in the south-west of France. 

The 12th International r3.0 conference held in September 2025 focused on bioregioning, offering a powerful catalyst for hundreds of people around the world to gather in local "confluences" held in their bioregions, deepening and exploring how these ideas, imaginings and practices could apply in their local contexts. 

A French language confluence held at Théra brought together a bioregioning "sisterhood" to deepen into their own bioregional context, exploring new insights about the rural exodus from the region, the terroir and people's cultural identity with the land, the opportunity of addressing traumas to bring inner / outer transformation, and much more. As Maria-Elena and Marie-Angel surface in this beautiful conversation, French bioregionalism has its own distinct cultural root, and offers a powerful opportunity to revisit history and ancestry, and co-envision thriving rural futures grounded in deep connection to the land.

As Media Partner for the @r3.0 conference, StoryMoss will continue to share stories of bioregional learning and activation in the coming weeks and months!

Thera website: https://thera.earth/

Enjoy the conversation!

Thanks to the StoryMoss team: Emmanuelle Chiche Dr. Pete Jeffs 🐴Dr Karen Lemke, PDC Salvador Perez David Burman

Bill Baue Ralph Thurm Design School for Regenerating Earth Penny L. Heiple Joe Brewer #storymoss

https://lnkd.in/dD4WP_55

3w • 

We are excited to have another new series called "Earth Regeneration in Practice" that begins in the Design School on October 14th. It will be a gathering place for real-world examples of regeneration at landscape and bioregional scales.

This series is hosted by Joe Brewer and will incorporate the work he supports in Latin America and throughout the world. Topics that will be explored include the science of Earth Systems, applied cultural evolution, bioregional learning centers, and regenerative finance for bioregional funding ecosystems.

Become a member of the Design School and join us!

Experience

Co-Founder

Design School for Regenerating Earth · Self-employed

Mar 2023 - Present · 2 yrs 8 mos

In the Design School for Regenerating Earth, we host online courses on organizational development, landscape restoration, and cooperation. One of our main focuses in the school is facilitating learning exchanges between bioregions  doing ecosystem restoration and working to create local living economies in their landscapes. We help to weave dialogues within and between bioregions, and we provide shared language, shared tools, and resources for organizing for regeneration at the landscape scale. 

My work as co-founder includes managing operational activities, finances, administration, technical support, and customer service for the school. In addition, I bring to the school my expertise in project management, community development, prosocial facilitation, biodynamic healing and trauma resolution, unified science, integral philosophy, and regenerative practice. With my comprehensive background in business, finance and project management, I bring a unique combination of heart and organizational expertise to the school.
